days.overview: Jesus promises to send another Helper who will be with believers forever—the Spirit of truth whom the world cannot receive. He dwells with and will be in believers.
days.reflection: Who is the Holy Spirit? What does it mean that He is your Helper? How is the Spirit with you?
days.prayer: Thank Jesus for sending the Holy Spirit and welcome His presence and help.

days.overview: Jesus says it's advantageous for Him to go so the Helper can come. The Spirit convicts the world concerning sin, righteousness, and judgment.
days.reflection: How does the Spirit convict of sin? What is His role regarding righteousness and judgment? When have you experienced His conviction?
days.prayer: Thank God for the Spirit's convicting work and ask for sensitivity to His voice.

days.overview: Jesus promises believers will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes upon them, making them witnesses in Jerusalem, Judea, Samaria, and to the end of the earth.
days.reflection: How does the Spirit give power? What does being His witness mean? Where is He sending you?
days.prayer: Ask the Holy Spirit to empower you to be Jesus' witness wherever you go.

days.overview: Paul teaches that the Spirit helps in weakness, interceding with groanings too deep for words. He intercedes for the saints according to God's will.
days.reflection: How does the Spirit help your weakness? What does His intercession mean? How does this comfort you?
days.prayer: Thank the Spirit for interceding for you and trust His prayers on your behalf.

days.overview: Paul describes varieties of gifts, service, and activities—all empowered by the same Spirit who apportions to each individually as He wills for the common good.
days.reflection: What spiritual gifts has the Spirit given you? How do you use them for the common good? How does diversity of gifts reflect unity?
days.prayer: Thank the Spirit for your gifts and ask how to use them better for God's glory.

days.overview: Paul lists the fruit of the Spirit: love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control. This fruit evidences the Spirit's transforming work.
days.reflection: Which fruit is most evident in you? Which needs cultivation? How does the Spirit produce this fruit?
days.prayer: Ask the Spirit to produce His fruit abundantly in your life.

days.overview: Paul commands believers not to be drunk with wine but be filled with the Spirit. Being Spirit-filled should characterize believers' lives.
days.reflection: What does being filled with the Spirit mean? How is this like or unlike drunkenness? How do you stay filled?
days.prayer: Ask to be continually filled with the Holy Spirit, yielding control to Him.
